TopicTitle: Heavy planes break the runway in 0.25?

Articles.Content:
You know that drop on runway when you launch a SPH vehicle? Apparently that's enough to break the runway...

I only have B9 installed. FAR not installed.

My other (lighter) B9 planes/Stearwing don't exhibit that behaviour.

//edit1: I made a 330t SP+ vehicle, it seems to have no problem with the drop. I believe it is due to the number of parts (328), and sheer size of the plane (the 375t has 4 B9 giant wings)

//edit2: My 4300 tons of HX awesome also did that.

Edited October 8, 2014 by mrwinesauce

Oh... joy. I hope that gets adjusted!

Edited October 8, 2014 by rdwulfe
Testing.
the tyrannical kerbal monarch installed AT mines inside the runway in order to reduce the absurdity (and casualties). also explains why concrete now appears to combust

How much weight is this?

Did you use the 64-bit Version?

32 bit version. 375t (as per MJ)

I made a 330t SP+ vehicle, it seems to have no problem with the drop. I believe it is due to the number of parts (328), and sheer size of the plane (the 375t has 4 B9 giant wings)

Edited October 8, 2014 by mrwinesauce
whoa, thats going to be a problem for me this weekend. Hoping theres a hotfix for this before then.
Should really be tested with big stock planes. I havent installed the update yet but that will be the first thing Ill do.

This is really freaking funny, you gotta admit. 'Sir! That plane's too heavy; the runway can't handle it!' 'Oh please, it's a slab of concrete, what's the worst that could happen?' Well, it cracks up, fire erupts, chaos ensues, all that.

'Sir! That plane's too heavy; the runway can't handle it!

Lol... hahahaha

Or maybe it's those dirty commies carpet-bombing your new design so you don't get technological superiority.

Think about it! It's not a bug, it's a feature.

This is really freaking funny, you gotta admit. 'Sir! That plane's too heavy; the runway can't handle it!' 'Oh please, it's a slab of concrete, what's the worst that could happen?' Well, it cracks up, fire erupts, chaos ensues, all that.

I told them many, many times those fishy looking "concrete" just "abandoned" on the side of the highway are not to be used, but NOOOO.

Or maybe it's those dirty commies carpet-bombing your new design so you don't get technological superiority.

Think about it! It's not a bug, it's a feature.

No matter, once the mothership is complete, there will be hell to pay.

Edited October 8, 2014 by mrwinesauce

Wasn't this a Disney movie?

"Negative, 1-3! You'll have to turn back! Our runway isn't long enough for a bird your size!"

"Not long enough? Look, pal! I can land this thing on a dime!"

Man I miss John Candy.

Edited October 8, 2014 by Alshain
Oh joy... Now I have to wait until the hotfix before I can launch my oversized planes again.

Oh joy... Now I have to wait until the hotfix before I can launch my oversized planes again.

i didnt even get .25 yet for reasons like this.

//edit1: I made a 330t SP+ vehicle, it seems to have no problem with the drop. I believe it is due to the number of parts (328), and sheer size of the plane (the 375t has 4 B9 giant wings)

Missed that (or maybe it was edited after my last post), so it seems the problem would be with B9
Runways? We don't need no stinkin' runways!
Yo mamma so fat, that when she went to work at KSC yesterday...

I wonder if you 'land' hard enough from air will break the runway as well.

Well; frankly speaking, runway do have their weight-limits...

Happens on the launchpad too:

A temporary fix is to enable indestructible buildings.
It's a feature!!!

I think a good way to get around this is to use those stability enhancers.

Yeah, those things.

(Note: The previously shown image is highly unstable and requires more stability enhancers than shown to function as expected.)
Tried spreading the load with extra landing gear?
Guys, guys, it's not a bug. Kerbals just use kerosene in their concrete mix instead of water!
this needs to get fixed... seriously

this needs to get fixed... seriously

I'd prefer it stays in...so long as the "big feature" that destructible buildings was a lead-up to is construction, and among the construction options are reinforced and supersized runways.
